law.catch_line: The Corporation may secure a bond by a trust agreement between the Corporation and a corporate trust...

section.section: The Corporation may secure a bond by a trust agreement between the Corporation and a corporate trustee.
A corporate trustee may be any trust company or bank that has the powers of a trust company in or outside the State.

A corporation or trust company incorporated in the State may:
act as depository of bond proceeds or revenues; and
furnish an indemnity bond or pledge security that the Corporation requires.

text.section: Expenses incurred in carrying out a trust agreement may be treated as part of the cost of operation of the Corporation.
